title: What are some of the interesting latest trends? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question is fairly broad and I’ll try to answer that in a few aspects for you. Chatbot. With customer experience(CX) being a hot topic now, every business is concerned with providing their customers the best customer services possible. Chatbot can be used to ease the load of customer support staffs and decrease the need of needing to repeat the same stuff over and over again.Artificial Intelligence. AI helps make better decisions and is a huge asset for delivering better accuracy for any industry. For instance, the medical field. Considering AI has just become more advanced in recent years, it is encouraged that a person starts before the field becomes too crowded. However, the AI field has a huge potential and we have at least a few decades to see it becomes a saturated job/field.Voice technology. This is one of the field that has gain a lot of recognition in recent years. Some company like Lyrebird is already on top of its game providing AI realistic voice cloning service with your own voice! Imagine no more robotic voice being narrated and the ability to save someone’s voice in your devices for eternal.Customer on demand. Today business is slowly shifting towards COD. It means that customers have the power over the services/products they are purchasing. In a nutshell, it means customers are able to do customization.

I recently stumbled upon this article on verge Apple releases $300 book containing 450 photos of Apple products Yes it is a reality, Apple has published a book named “Designed by Apple in California”. The book features 450 photographs of Apple products released since last 20 years.    The book comes in two sizes - smaller sized book costing 199 dollars and larger sized book costing 299 dollars. Apple has even released a video on this book. “Designed by Apple in California” Chronicles 20 Years of Apple Design I am just wondering who would buy this book and what will they get by staring at those photographs. [1] Footnotes[1] Apple releases $300 book containing 450 photos of Apple products
